It is characterized by its distinctive rhomboid-shaped capsules that mature and release spores. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Its structure includes a delicate stem with leaf-like structures that aid in water retention. Nomismia rhomboidea plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for other small organisms.
